thread.title: Great Wolf Resorts names new CEO
thread.title_full: Great Wolf Resorts names new CEO

author: David Schuyler
title: Great Wolf Resorts names new CEO
text:
Great Wolf Resorts names new CEO Aug 7, 2015, 9:57am CDT Industries & Tags David Schuyler Digital Producer Milwaukee Business Journal David Schuyler Digital Producer Milwaukee Business Journal Related Content Provided by Great Wolf Lodge The water park at Great Wolf Lodge in Wisconsin Dells Three months after being acquired by a New York City private investment firm, Great Wolf Resorts Inc. announced that a new chief executive officer will take over Sept. 22. The Madison-based operator of the Great Wolf Lodge chain of indoor water park resorts named Carnival Cruise Line executive Ruben Rodriguez as the new chief executive officer to replace Kimberly Schaefer , who will become chief brand officer. Schaefer will remain in the post until the end of the year before transitioning to the company's board of directors in 2016. Rodriguez, 52, most recently served as executive vice president, ship operations, for Carnival, leading hospitality operations, onboard revenues, marine operations and shared services across 24 cruise ships carrying approximately five million guests per year. Great Wolf Resorts was acquired in May 2015 by Centerbridge Partners LP of New York City. Centerbridge pledged to continue to grow the chain and move it into new markets. The Great Wolf Lodge chain has 12 resorts with additional resorts to open in 2016 in Garden Grove, Calif., and Colorado Spring, Colo.
